page.title: 14CHRIST'S COLLEGE
page.content: The tower of Christ's College with its green copper roof is perhaps Finchley's best known landmark. The date 1860 and "E.R.", the initials of the architect, Edward Roberts, appear high on the south-west face of the building. A distinctive feature is the pattern of Tudor-style diaper decoration in blue-black bricks. The original school was founded in 1857 by the then rector of St.Mary's church Rev.White, in Church House at the end of the churchyard.This building had previously been let as the Queen's Head Pub. The school soon became very succesful and popular that it was forced to move to its present site opposite the church.
